Utterance: <sync>
Hi, it’s good to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hey, I’ve been okay. A bit up and down, but overall, I’m trying to focus on the positive.
That’s great to hear. Last time, you mentioned feeling better with the change in weather. Have you been able to maintain that positivity?
Yes, definitely! I’ve been walking my dog more, and I even started going to a local hiking group.
That sounds wonderful! How has that experience been for you?
It’s been really nice. I met some new people, and it feels good to be outdoors again. I forgot how much I love hiking.
That’s fantastic! Engaging in activities you enjoy can really help with mood. Have you noticed any changes in your overall feelings since joining the group?
I feel more connected, and it helps with the loneliness I sometimes feel. I think being around others who share similar interests is uplifting.
That’s a significant step forward. You mentioned loneliness last time. Have you been able to address that in other areas of your life?
Yes, I’ve been reaching out to friends more often. I even hosted a small game night last weekend.
That’s excellent! How did that go?
It was a lot of fun! We played some board games and just laughed a lot. It felt good to have people in my space.
It sounds like you’re building a supportive network. How do you feel about your ability to maintain these connections?
I think I’m getting better at it. I’ve realized that I need to prioritize relationships more.
That’s a valuable insight. What do you think has changed in your perspective?
I think I’ve started to value my own needs more. I used to think I was a burden to others, but now I see that friendships are mutual.
That’s a healthy realization. Have you had any challenges in this area?
Sometimes I still feel anxious about reaching out, like I’m interrupting someone’s life.
That’s common. Have you tried any coping strategies when those feelings arise?
I usually remind myself that it’s okay to ask for help and that friends want to be there for each other.
That’s a great strategy! It shows you’re working on your self-acceptance. Have you noticed any improvements in your anxiety levels overall?
Yes, I think so. I’m trying to practice mindfulness when I feel overwhelmed.
Mindfulness can be a powerful tool. Can you share how you practice it?
I’ve been doing some guided meditations, focusing on my breath. It helps calm my racing thoughts.
That’s wonderful! How do you feel after practicing mindfulness?
I feel more centered and less reactive. It’s like I can step back and observe my thoughts instead of getting caught up in them.
That’s an important skill to develop. Have you noticed any specific situations where this has helped you?
Definitely. I had a tough conversation with my fiancé about finances, and instead of getting defensive, I stayed calm and listened.
That’s a significant achievement! How did that conversation go?
It was productive. We both shared our concerns, and I felt like we were really communicating.
Communication is key in any relationship. It sounds like you’re making progress. Are there any other areas you feel you’d like to work on?
I think I still struggle with self-doubt, especially regarding my career path.
That’s understandable. What specifically makes you feel doubtful?
I often question if I’m capable of pursuing my interests in animals. I worry I might fail.
It’s natural to have those fears. Have you considered taking small steps towards that goal?
I have! I’ve been volunteering at an animal shelter on weekends, which feels fulfilling.
That’s a fantastic way to gain experience and build confidence. How has that been for you?
It’s been really rewarding. I love being around the animals, and it feels good to contribute.
That sounds like a meaningful experience. How do you feel about the future in relation to this path?
I feel hopeful. I think I can explore this further, maybe even consider taking some courses.
That’s a great plan! Setting small, achievable goals can help you build momentum. Would you like to set a goal for this next week?
Yes, I’d like to research some local courses or workshops related to animal care.
That’s a perfect goal! How about we check in on that in our next session?
Sounds good to me!
Great! I’m really proud of the progress you’re making. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
No, I think we covered a lot. Thank you for your support!
You’re welcome! I look forward to hearing about your research next time. Take care!
